DOC.brief_summary: Study compare different group people respond application non-pneumatic anti-shock garment . Investigators divide recruit participant three group base health status ( group 1 : hemodialysis patient ; group 2 : patient severe chronic kidney disease dialysis ; group 3 : healthy participant clinically know kidney disease ) . Each group , comprise 10 people , receive treatment use non-pneumatic anti-shock garment .
DOC.brief_title: Hemodynamic Responses Hemodialysis Patients Blood Flow Restriction Using Non-pneumatic Anti-shock Garments
DOC.detailed_description: Primary Aim : To determine blood flow restriction low extremity use non-pneumatic anti-shock garment affect hemodynamic cardiovascular parameter blood pressure Hemodialysis ( HD ) patient dialysis . Investigators propose pilot study assess effect blood flow restriction use non-pneumatic anti-shock garment HD patient dialysis . Outcomes : The primary objective measurement blood pressure upon application non-pneumatic anti-shock garment . Secondary outcome include follow : baroreflex sensitivity ; trend beat-to-beat blood pressure upon application anti-shock garment ; patient tolerability non-pneumatic anti-shock garment , ejection fraction via echocardiogram analysis .
DOC.criteria: Healthy participant 1 . Male female , age≥18 year old 2 . No clinical diagnosis CKD CKD patient dialysis 1 . Male female , age≥18 year old 2 . Stage 4 Stage 5 CKD patient CKD patient dialysis 1 . Male female , age≥18 year old 2 . Patients haemodialysis treatment least 3 time per week London Health Sciences Centre facility 1 . Not meet inclusion criterion 2 . Severe heart failure ( New York Heart Association grade IV ) 3 . Pulmonary hypertension 4 . Mitral stenosis 5 . Cardiac transplant recipient 6 . Mental incapacity consent 7 . Declined participate 8 . Absence low limb low limb injury 9 . Pregnancy
